characters: ON SCREEN INT. CAROL MARCUS' LAB, REGULA I

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: Absolute quiet. SOUND bleeds in. Low level b.g. NOISES of Enterprise bridge, clicking of relays, minor electronic effects. We HEAR A FEMALE VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's log. Stardate 8130.3, Starship Enterprise on training mission to Gamma Hydra. Section 14, coordinates 22/87/4. Approaching Neutral Zone, all systems functioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ANGLE WIDENS, we see the crew at stations; (screens and visual displays are in use): COMMANDER SULU at the helm, COMMANDER UHURA at the Comm Con- sole, DR. BONES McCOY and SPOCK at his post. The Captain is new -- and unexpected. LT. SAAVIK is young and beautiful. She is half Vulcan and half Romulan. In appearance she is Vulcan with pointed ears, but her skin is fair and she has none of the expressionless facial immobility of a Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving Section Fourteen for Section Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Project parabolic course to avoid entering Neutral Zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Captain... I'm getting something on the distress channel. Minimal signal... But something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you amplify?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course change projected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an emergency distress call!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On speakers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered, breaking up) Imperative! Imperative! This is the Kobayashi Maru -- nineteen periods out of Altair Six. We have struck a gravitic mine and have lost all power... Our hull is... (breaks up, static) ... and many casualties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Starship Enterprise. Your message is breaking up. Give your coordinates. Repeat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, our position is Gamma Hydra, Section Ten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the neutral zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull penetrated, life support systems failing. Can you assist  us, Enterprise? Can you... Breaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Data on Kobayashi Maru! Tactical! Tactical on big screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subject vessel is third class neutronic fuel carrier, crew of eighty-one, three hundred passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. (then) Mr. Sulu, plot an intercept course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I remind the Captain that if a Starship enters the zone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm aware of my responsibilities, Mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nod) ... Now entering the Neutral  Zone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warning. We have entered the Neutral Zone... Warning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimating two minutes to intercept. On screen: Enterprise approaches the stricken vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by transporter room, ready to beam survivors, aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I've lost their signal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alert. Sensors indicate three Klingon Cruisers, bearing 316, mark 4, closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual! On screen we see the approach  of the Klingon vessels, they are dark and sinister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Battle stations! Activate shields! The ALARM SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields activated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inform the Klingons we are on a rescue mission...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're jamming all frequencies, Captain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingons on attack course and closing. Screen verifies this. Saavik makes an agonized choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're over our heads. Mr. Sulu, get us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon cruisers approaching, bearing 090, mark 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual! The image flops: more Klingons approach. They FIRE photon torpedoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Evasive action! Sulu does his best, but Enterprise is hit; Sulu is hurled from his station, and Bones hurries to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Engineering! damage report!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main energizer hit, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engage auxiliary power. Prepare to return fire! The bridge takes another hit -- a big one. In its wake there is a second electrical EXPLOSION along the communi- cations panel. Uhura falls from her station. Bones rushes to her side amid the smoke and alarms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields collapsing, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we're losing auxiliary power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire all phasers...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No power to the weapons system, sir. Another hit: reverberating flashes of spark and flame on the bridge. Spock dies. Bones comes to him, but even as he coughs his way through the smoke, a final hit and Bones falls. The room is smoke filled and a shambles. Saavik looks about in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, it's no use. We're dead in space. Saavik digests this for a painful moment. Then, touch- ing a comm button:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activate escape pods. Send out the Log Buoy... All hands abandon ship. Repeat -- all hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, open her up. There is a loud CLANGING and  --

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The side walls of the "bridge" slide apart, revealing a lighted room beyond. Through the opening strides KIRK. He stops, surveys the shambles, and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any suggestions, Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prayer, Mr. Saavik. The Klingons do not take prisoners. (to Spock) Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trainees to the briefing room. Sulu awakens with a grin. Uhura straightens herself demurely. The Trainees head toward the distant room, Spock rises and leaves. Bones remains on the floor, head propped in his hand, whimsically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physician, heal thyself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you have to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a drama critic. Bones rolls his eyes and rises. Kirk sees Saavik who has not moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, Mr. Saavik, are you going to stay with the sinking ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to speak candidly, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fights emotion) I don't believe this was a fair test of my command capabilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... there was no way to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A no-win situation is a possibility every commander may face. Has that never occurred to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No, sir. It has not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we deal with death is at least as important as how we deal with life, wouldn't you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falters) As I indicated, Admiral, that thought had not occurred to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have something new to think about. Carry on. She stays at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it be easier to put an experienced crew back on the ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll learn. Galloping about the cosmos is a game for the young, doctor. He leaves. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended) What is that supposed to mean? HOLD ON Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk rounds the corner and sees Spock, leaning against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) Aren't you dead? Spock almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I assume you are loitering here to learn what efficiency rating I plan to give your cadets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am understandably curious. They walk together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They destroyed the simulator room and you with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kobayshi Maru scenario  frequently wreaks havoc with students and equipment. (dry) As I recall you took the test three times yourself. Your final solution was, shall we say, unique?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemn) It had the virtue of never having been tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours was not a solution which would have occurred to a Vulcan mentality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you said at the time. Speaking of which, your protВ‚gВ‚'s first rare -- a trifle emotional --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's half Romulan, Jim. The admixture makes her more volatile than -- me, for example.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Than you. Yes, I see that. By the way, thank you for this. He lifts the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know of your fondness for antiques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads) 'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...' Message, Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of which I am consciously aware -- except, of course, happy birthday -- surely the best of times. Kirk looks around uncomfortably, overlaps:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hrummm... and where are you off to, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise. I must check in before your inspection. And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shortly) Home. Spock studies him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something oppresses you. They are old friends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something. He steps into a turbo elevator. The doors close as Spock watches, wiping the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In f.g. is the U.S.S. RELIANT, an older, somewhat battered starship of the ENTERPRISE class, with a slightly different configuration. Reliant approaches an inhospitable-looking yellow planet: CETI ALPHA V

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starship log, Stardate 8130.4. This report classified MOST SECRET. Log Entry by Commander Pavel Chekov, Duty Officer. Starship USS Reliant on orbital approach with Ceti Alpha VI in connection with project code name GENESIS. We are continuing our search for a lifeless planet which will serve as a suitable test site for the Genesis Experiments. This is the 16th planet we have visited, so far, no success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-aged and distinctive. The usual compliment of officers and crew. CAPTAIN CLARK TERRELL, about 45, soft spoken and in good shape, but somewhat laconic. Behind Terrell, surveying the data screen is COMMANDER CHEKOV, aged some, but still boyish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard orbit, Mr. Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard orbit, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any change in surface scan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Limited atmosphere, dominated by craylon gas, sand and high velocity winds. Incapable of supporting life forms. Forward screen: Ceti Alpha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it have to be completely lifeless? Terrell rises and crosses to Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you've got something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) We've picked up a minor energy flux reading on one dyno scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! Are you sure? Maybe the scanner's out of adjustment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose it could be a particle of preanimate matter caught in the matrix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's get on the Comm-pic to Doctor Marcus. Maybe it's something we can transplant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what she'll say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A functional cluster of modules serve as a scientific complex, a futuristic White Sands, orbiting a small barren plantoid in b.g.: Regula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something you can transplant? I don't know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big but deserted except for Carol, in contact with Reliant. Surrounded by equipment clearly meant for many workers, CAROL MARCUS is in her early forties, attractive and intelligent. Static mars the trans- missions. On the monitor: Terrell and Chekov, looking hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might only be a particle of preanimate matter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then again it might not. You boys have to be clear on this: there can't be so much as a microbe or the show's off. (she thinks) Why don't you have a look? If it IS something that can be moved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eager) You bet, doctor. We're on our way! Carol sighs as the image fades, not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol walks through the labyrinthine complex with DAVID, her son, a bright young scientist of twenty. He is good looking and humorous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you let them pull that stuff on you? They're just lazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bored. I know. But maybe it IS something they can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mother, that's just the military mentality. Never put off tomorrow what you can put off today. If there's one atom of life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know... Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't have kittens. Genesis is going to work. They'll remember  you in a wreath with Newton, Einstein, Surak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock outrage) Thanks a lot. No respect from my offspring --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Par for the course... you teaming up with me for bridge after dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time we have dealings with Starfleet, I get nervous. (shrugs) We're dealing with something that COULD be perverted into a dreadful weapon. Remember that overgrown boy scout you used to hang out with? That's exactly the -- They walk past the CAMERA, their VOICES FADING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, kiddo, Jim Kirk was many things, but he was never a Boy Scout... HOLD ON the empty corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk reads the novel, trying to focus. His flat befits an Admiral and a loner with few possessions, except a collection of antiques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Kirk lowers the book and pushes a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. The door slides open and Bones enters. He carries two packages, one of them wrapped in brown paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bless me, doctor; and what beams you into this neck of the woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Beware Romulans bearing gifts.' Happy Birthday... With a flourish, he pulls out a bottle of blue liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romulan Ale! Bones, you know this stuff is illegal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (broad) I only use it for medicinal purposes. Don't be a pring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the label with difficulty) Twenty-two, eighty-three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes the stuff a while to ferment. Gimme. He takes the bottle and pours; continues talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now open the other one. Kirk starts to obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm almost afraid to. What did you bring me, contraband Klingon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More antiques for your collection -- Cheers! They drink. The package is opened: a pair of gold "Ben Franklin" half-glasses. (N.B.: Romulan Ale is an INSTANT DRUNK: both men react.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers. Bones, these are... charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred years old. You don't find many with the lens still intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh -- what are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your eyes. For most patients of your age, I generally administer Retlax Five to restore flexibility of the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm allergic to Retlax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Happy birthday. He toasts. Kirk is unsure how they work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Slide them down your nose. Now look at me over the top. And you read printed matter through the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts) Amazing! I don't know what to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Jim, what the hell's the matter? Other people have birthdays. Why're we treating yours like a funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, I don't want to be lectured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What DO you want? Damn it, why isn't there a girl here? You know this has nothing to do with age. This is about you flying a goddamn computer console when you wanna be out hopping Galaxies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare me your notions of poetry, please. We all have our assigned duties and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bull. You're hiding -- hiding behind the rules and regulations --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who am I hiding from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From yourself, Admiral. Pause. Kirk pours another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mince words, Bones; tell me what you really think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mild take) I'm your doctor and I'm your friend,  Jim. Get back your command. Get it back before you really do grow old. Before you turn into part of this collection. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: orbiting Ceti Alpha V. VOICES OVER indicate the transporter room is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YELLOW PLANET, in constant SWIRLING HURRICANE WINDS OF SAND. Terrell and Chekov materialize. Their VOICES, filtered, are hard to make out. With the TRICORDER to guide them, they set out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure these are the coordinates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, this is the garden spot of Ceti Alpha VI --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hardly see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The difficult search, the men leaning into the wind --

dialogues.speaker: TERRELL
dialogues.text: is ahead of Chekov on a slight rise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing, let's go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrell waves him frantically forward. As Chekov moves up, we rise with him to the top of the ridge and look down.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POV
dialogues.text: A RUINED SERIES OF MAN-MADE STRUCTURES, half buried in sand. They look at each other in consternation. Chekov is worried; something about all this is familiar. They descend towards the structures, now seen to be the wreckage of some sort of space craft. They pass but do not notice the FEDERATION LOGO, half buried next to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look like cargo carriers... As Chekov looks at the porthole, a face suddenly looks back! It is the face of a CHILD! The Apparition scares the daylights out of Chekov -- and us. He screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What is it? He comes clumsily over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A face! I saw -- it was like a child -- He points. The porthole is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an air-lock. He points and they go into the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrell and Chekov enter, dumbfounded. THEIR POV. Someone lives here -- there are beds, food, all jury- rigged -- but no people. Terrell checks a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's breathable atmosphere in here. He takes off his helmet; Chekov likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the hell is this? Did they crash? Where's the rest of the ship? They wander as they talk, picking up objects that be- speak a fairly sophisticated ad hoc environment: a laboratory in one hold; a kitchen; A LARGE SAND TANK filled with disgusting CETI EELS. ABRUPTLY A SOUND -- They start: CHILD'S GURGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) I told you! I told you I saw a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssssh! They start looking. They enter a new chamber --

dialogues.speaker: KHAN'S QUARTERS
dialogues.text: On its side in the sand: the walls are now the floor, etc. All in crookedness -- like its owner. On the floor, smiling at them (i.e., the wall) is a BABY. Tentatively they come over to it, looking around --

dialogues.speaker: CHEKOV'S POV
dialogues.text: Lethal-looking odd swords on one wall, a bookshelf; CAMERA PANS by 20th Century volumes; MOBY DICK, KING LEAR, THE HOLY BIBLE -- and a seat belt dangling with the name on it -- Botany Bay. Chekov mouths the words, softly at first, then aloud --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Botany Bay -- oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examines the child) What's the matter -- ? Chekov runs, tries to get his helmet on, tries to drag Terrell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we've got to get out of here -- now! Damn! Hurry! Terrell catches his urgency --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the child --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrell and Chekov emerge, helmeted, then stop dead.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POV
dialogues.text: A RING OF SUITED FIGURES has them surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Beach, the duty officer, stands looking at Ceti Alpha V on the forward screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starship Reliant to Captain Terrell ... This is Lieutenant Kyle. Will you please respond, Captain... Captain Terrell, respond please. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) Let's give them a little more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrell and Chekov are held by FOUR STRONG MEN. They seem to be waiting. One of the men is JOACHIM. Out of the airlock steps a tall masked figure. A moment of suspense as Terrell and Chekov watch, terri- fied. The mask is peeled back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aloud despite himself) Khan! KHAN is startled by the recognition; comes over and examines Chekov and Terrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) I don't know you. But you. I never forget a face. Mister Chekov, isn't it? (wonderingly) I never thought to see your face again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov, who is this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A criminal, Captain -- a product of the late 20th Century genetic engineering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want with us? I demand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mild) You are in a position to demand nothing, sir. I, on the other hand, am in a position to grant nothing. What you see is all that remains of the ship's company and the crew of the Botany Bay, marooned here fifteen years ago by Captain James T. Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me -- you men and women --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your strength, Captain, these people have sworn to live and die at my command two hundred years before you were born. Do you mean he... (i.e. Chekov) ... never told you the tale? To amuse you, Captain? Never told you how the Enterprise picked up the Botany Bay, lost in space from the year 1996, myself and the ship's company in cryogenic freeze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never even met Admiral Kirk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral? He didn't tell you how Admiral Kirk sent seventy of us into exile on this barren sand heap with only the contents of these cargo bays to sustain us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie! On Ceti Alpha V there was life, a fair chance to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ceti Alpha V! Ceti Alpha VI exploded six months after we were left here. The shock shifted the orbit of this planet and everything was laid waste. Admiral Kirk never bothered to check on our progress. It was only the fact of my genetically engineered intellect that enabled us to survive! On earth, two hundred years ago, I was a prince, with power over millions -- now, like Prometheus I have been left by Admiral Kirk to digest my own entrails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Kirk was your host! You repaid his hospitality by trying to steal his ship and murder him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moves closer) And I'll wager he never told you about his shipmate, the beautiful and courageous Lieutenant McGiver, who gave up everything to join me in exile. OUT OF LOVE. And see how Admiral Kirk requited her devotion -- She's dead as earth! The wind howls in the silence. When Khan turns, his eyes are filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) A plague upon you all. He recovers his poise and returns to them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You didn't expect to find me. You thought this was Ceti Alpha VI. Why are you here? They don't answer. Khan goes over to Terrell and, WITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why? Terrell gasps, stays silent --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) No matter. He lets go; Terrell falls with a thud --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You will soon tell me willingly enough. He goes over to the tank and dips a kind of strainer in, pulling out TWO CETI EELS -- wriggling items --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let me introduce you to Ceti Alpha V's only remaining indigenous life form; what do you think? They've killed twenty of my people, including my beloved wife. Oh, not all at once and not instantly, to be sure. Their young enter through the ears and wrap themselves around the cerebral cortex. This has the effect of rendering the victim extremely susceptible to suggestion. Later, as they grow, follows madness, paralysis -- and death. These are pets, of course -- not quite domesticated. As he speaks, Khan dumps an eel in each of their helmets; he swirls the helmets around as though he were mixing martinis --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan, listen to me! Captain Kirk was only doing his duty! You --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is some pain at first, I am told, and then the effects are quite benign -- until the end. That was what I learned from watching my wife. At a sign, the helmets are slammed down. As the muffled shrieks are heard from within, the eels crawl across the faces of Chekov and Terrell; with unerring in- stincts they head for the ears of the two hapless men. There is some atrocious pain as they enter -- then dazed calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's better! Now: tell me why you are here -- and tell me where I may find James Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Terrell. Captain Terrell... This is Reliant; please respond. No answer -- Beach makes up his mind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kyle, muster a landing party with full arms. Alert the transporter room. We're beaming down. He heads for the door but is stopped by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Reliant, this is Terrell. Respond please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Reliant. Clark, are you all right? Fractional pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Everything's fine, commander. I'll explain when I see you. Oh, by the  way, we're bringing several guests aboard. Prepare to beam up on my next signal. Terrell out. Beach and Kyle look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we ARE transplanting something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPACE SHUTTLE moving toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new composite. Bones, Sulu, Uhura and Kirk -- who sits, reading. Through the windows we can see the approach to the starship ENTERPRISE. Kirk looks up, nods. Sulu activates a comm button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, this is Admiral Kirk's party on final approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Enterprise welcomes you. Prepare  for docking. Kirk looks up from his book as Sulu sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really must thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I am delighted; any chance to go aboard Enterprise, however briefly, is always an excuse for nostalgia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cut your new orders personally. By the end of the month, you'll have your first command: USS EXCELSIOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I've looked forward to this for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've earned it. But I'm still grateful to have you at the helm for three weeks. I don't believe these kids can steer. Sulu laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle approaches the mammoth airstrip. As we near the ship, a few WORK CREWS IN SPACE flit about her hull, working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle makes its way to the Docking Lock of the mother ship and settles in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reception group awaits, led by Captain Spock. Saavik stands at his side, in company of the Trainee crew. Also present: CHIEF ENGINEER MR. SCOTT and members of his staff in their distinctive uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Docking procedure complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare for Admiral's inspection. The group comes to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Open the Air Lock. The doors open. Kirk and his staff are piped aboard by an electronic version of the boatswain's tradi- tional whistle. Kirk salutes the Federation symbol and steps forward to exchange salutes with Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to come aboard, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard, Admiral. I believe you know my trainee crew. Certainly they have come to know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly to Saavik) Yes, we've been through death and life together. Saavik stiffens slightly -- humor is not her forte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to Scotty) Mr. Scott, you old space dog. You're well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had me a wee bout -- but Dr. McCoy pulled me through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? A wee bout of what, Mr. Scott? Uncomfortable, Scotty exchanges a glance with Bones --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shore leave, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. He stops before a BRIGHT-FACED FOURTEEN-YEAR OLD, stand- ing so stiff he looks like he'll break -- in an engineer's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Midshipman First Class Peter Preston, engineers mate, SIR. A big salute. Kirk is amused, returns the salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your first training voyage, Mr. Preston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, SIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Well, shall we start with the engine room? He moves, followed by his staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing his protВ‚gВ‚) I believe you'll find all in order --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see you on the bridge, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Mr. Spock. Kirk and party leave. CAMERA PUSHES IN ON SPOCK AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not what I expected, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain) He's very human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't all be perfect, Saavik. You must control your prejudices and remember that as a Vulcan as well as a Romulan you are forever a stranger in an alien land. Around you are humans, and as a member of the Starfleet you are unlikely ever to escape their presence or their influence. You must learn to tolerance in addition to all else I have taught you. Tolerance is logical. Saavik is humbled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As always, my mentor. Company dismiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inspection party dwarfed by the size. Silence as Kirk looks around, runs a finger for dust, etc. Scotty, his team and Preston, stand at attention.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR OF ENGINE ROOM
dialogues.text: FEATURING power room separated by glass from the rest of the facilities. Bones, Sulu, Uhura, and some train- ees watch as Kirk inspects one console, clearly the responsibility of the bursting Midshipman Preston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting) I believe you'll find everything shipshape, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly puts him on) Oh do you? Have you any idea, Midshipman Preston, how many times I've had to listen to Mr. Scott on the Comm, telling me his troubles? Have you any idea the ribbing I've had to endure in the officers' mess to the effect that the Enterprise is a flying death trap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scandalized) Oh, no, sir! This is the finest engine room in the whole Star -- The repressed grins of the others, and a smile on Scotty' face tell Preston he's being had. He stops, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If the Admiral can't see the facts for himself, then, with all due respect, he's as blind as a Tiberion bat. SIR. Approving laughter. Kirk looks amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midshipman, you're a tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister's youngest, Admiral. Crazy to get to space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every young boy's fancy. I seem to remember it myself. (brisk) Very well. Mr. Scott, are your engines capable of handling a minor training cruise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the word, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, the word is given.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. He moves off, followed by Preston, who gives one last salute as Kirk leaves, followed by Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) What about the rest of the inspection, Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inspection will continue once we're underway, Doctor. They step into the Turbo Lifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real one, no doubt! CAMERA REVEALS the maze detail: winking and blinking displays, all HANDS at station, a hum of activity, Uhura and Sulu in familiar chairs, Spock is in the Captain's chair, Saavik in the First Officer's position. Kirk and Bones stand towards the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Starfleet operations. Enterprise is cleared for departure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral on the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, Mr. Saavik, clear all moorings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Saavik punches data into her console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dock slowly folds away from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik watches instruments, punches data in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All moorings are clear, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Saavik. Spock casts a glance at Kirk, then, to Saavik:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lieutenant, how many times have you piloted a Starship out of Spacedock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never, sir. Kirk tries to conceal his reaction. Spock enjoys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her out, Mr. Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Saavik settles herself in the chair, looks again at the console -- Spock looks at Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a first time for everything, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casual) To be sure, Captain. They all stifle their responses. Kirk is like a father watching his kid drive the family car for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aft thrusters, Mr. Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aft thrusters, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the ship slowly and majestically leaves the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activity hums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead one quarter impulse power. Kirk starts to say something, but doesn't. Bones looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voice) Would you like a tranquilizer? Kirk shakes his head, takes a breath --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead one quarter impulse power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship clears the dock and begins heading into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk quietly lets his breath out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are clear and free to navigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course heading, Captain? Spock turns inquiringly to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's discretion. Spock digests this with a slight smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, you may follow your nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers speed into the vastness of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving towards us, in opposition to the previous shot, close enough for us to read her markings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan occupies the Captain's chair. We PULL BACK: the crew of the RELIANT has been replaced by Khan's fol- lowers in their odd-looking clothes. At the helm is Joachim, Khan's lieutenant. He is in the largest and brightest of Khan's group. Terrell sits in the First Officer's chair, Chekov at the Comm Console. Their behavior is normal, save for subtle hesitation, symptoms of their mind-controlled state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady on course. All systems normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not much different from Enterprise. (beat) When I was a guest aboard her some years ago, Captain Kirk kindly allowed me to memorize her technical manuals. And now, Mr. Chekov, let us review: You say you have no details of Project 'Genesis' ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond what I told you, sir, it is classified information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm. And would Admiral Kirk have access to such information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would think so, sir. He's on the Fleet General Staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then to whom do you report directly regarding Genesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Doctor Marcus, the civilian director of the experiments on Space Laboratory Regula I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) I see. Helmsman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak? We're all with you, sir, but consider: we are free, we have a ship and the means to go where we will. We have escaped permanent exile on Ceti Alpha V. You have proved your superior intellect and defeated the plans of Admiral Kirk. You do not need to defeat him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tasks me -- and I'll have him. I'll chase him round the moons of Nibia and round the Antares maelstrom and round perdition's flames before I give him up. (as no one speaks) Prepare to alter course -- for Space Station Regula I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge and busy. Among the scientists going about their tasks are JEDDA, a Deltan; MARCH, thin intense; MADISON, black, easy going. They are all young and earnest. Carol and David huddle over a computer console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that about do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think there's another piece of information we could squeeze into the memory banks. Next time, we'll design a bigger one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who -- Jedda at the Comm Console overlaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comm-Pic coming in on hyperchannel ... It's Reliant. Carol moves forward as the others close in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen, please, Jedda. Buttons punched; the screen ebbs, flows and crackles on. ON SCREEN is CHEKOV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... come in, please. This is Reliant calling Regula I. Repeat. This is USS Reliant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, we are receiving. This is Regula I. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Marcus... good. We're en route to you and should be there in three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: En route? Why? We weren't expecting you for another three months. Has something happened? (pause) Has something happened? Do you read  us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fractional pause) All went well. Nothing has happened. Ceti Alpha VI has checked out. Pleased reaction from the scientists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't under --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have received new orders. Upon our arrival at Regula I, all materials of Project Genesis will be transferred to this ship for immediate testing at Ceti Alpha VI. Consternation in the lab. David is livid -- the words "Bullshit" are overlapped  by his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please be quiet! (back to console) Commander Chekov, this is completely irregular. Who gave the order you are quoting? Who gave the order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still smiling) The order comes from Starfleet command, Dr. Marcus, direct from the General Staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Genesis is a civilian project, under my control --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pin him down, mother! Who gave the orders!? Chekov hesitates, seems to be listening to someone off the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orders come from Admiral James T. Kirk. Sensation in the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it! I knew it! All along the military has wanted to get their hands on this -- He starts to press a button; Carol pushes his hand away and communicates herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is completely improper, Commander Chekov. I have no intention of allowing Reliant or any other unauthorized personnel access to our work or materials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses; listens) I'm sorry you feel that way, Doctor. Admiral Kirk's orders are confirmed. Please prepare to deliver Genesis to us upon our arrival. Reliant out. The image fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Chekov -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov, in a matched cut, turns away as CAMERA WIDENS TO REVEAL KHAN by his side. He is charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize, sir, that they will attempt to contact Admiral Kirk and confirm the order. Khan smiles, more charming than ever as we move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is talking at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please be quiet! We must have order here. (as they subside) This has to be some sort of mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mistake? We're all alone here. They waited until everyone was on shift-leave to do this. Reliant is supposed to be at our disposal, not vice-versa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems clear that Starfleet never intended that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried to warn you. Scientists are always pawns of the military --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Starfleet has kept the peace for a hundred years, I cannot and will not subscribe to your  interpretation of this event. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Deltan cool) You may be right, Doctor, but what about Reliant? She's on her way. Carol reacts: this is certainly true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your gear together where it's handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for us to know and Reliant to find out. We have only three days. Let's not waste time. They split off in different directions as ordered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In no particular hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk waits for the Turbo Lift, which opens at last. As he gets in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold please -- ! Kirk holds and Saavik dashes in. She is surprised to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Thank you, sir. Kirk nods, the doors close. There is an uneasy forced intimacy between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, are you wearing your hair differently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is still regulation, Admiral. She reaches out and touches a button. The lift stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) May I speak, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, self-expression does not seem to be one of your problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to thank you for the high  efficiency rating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You earned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bothered by your performance on the Kobayashi Maru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I failed to resolve the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no correct resolution. It is a test of character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask how you dealt with the test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) You may ask, Lieutenant. She stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That was a little joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humor... that is a difficult concept ... it is not logical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We learn by doing, Lieutenant. She's a laugh a minute. Kirk pushes the button; the elevator starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You want my advice? She studies him, considering. No doubt about it, the attraction is mutual and she has no idea how to handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the test again. The lift stops and the doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's been holding up the damn elevator? He reacts to them. Saavik exits demurely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Bones enters and the doors close. Kirk studies the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has she changed her hairstyle? Kirk says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Wonderful stuff, that Romulan ale --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Kirk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an urgent CommPic from Space Lab Regula I for the Admiral. Dr. Carol Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my quarters, Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never rains but when it pours --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a physician you of all people should appreciate the danger of re-opening old wounds. The elevator stops. Kirk leaves. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed with himself) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring VIEW SCREEN: A scramble of interference and noise. A piece of Carol's VOICE breaks through now and again as we PULL BACK revealing a frustrated Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura. Can't you augment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying, sir. Stand by... Carol's face appears. The image will never be stable for long; sometimes the sound will be covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... read me? Can you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message breaking up, Carol. What's wrong? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Can't read you... repeat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat... what's wrong? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... taking Genesis away from us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking Genesis? Who? Who is taking Genesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... see you but can't hear. Did you... order...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What order? Who's taking Genesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Please help us, Jim... won't let them have... without proper... repeat... on whose authority...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim please -- But the picture is irrevocably scrambled now. Kirk pounds the Comm in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura! What's happening? Damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmission jammed at the source, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Alert Starfleet Headquarters. I want to talk with Starfleet Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cruising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The activity is normal. The Turbo-Lift opens and Kirk strides in. Bones and Saavik react to the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop engines. They look wonderingly. Kirk takes a breath --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An emergency situation has arisen. By order of Starfleet Command, as of now, 1800 hours, I am assuming command of this vessel. Duty officer so note in the ship's log. Plot a new course: for Space Laboratory Regula I. (pushes a button) Mr. Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be going to warp speed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Course plotted for Regula I, Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engage warp engines --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes out of being stunned) Prepare for warp speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, go to Warp 5. Sulu does, and with a great thrust of energy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship accelerates, and then, with an eye-filled burst, whips ahead to warp speed, disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock is at meditation as Kirk enters quietly. Spock looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a problem. Spock raises an eyebrow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Something may be wrong at Regula I. We've been ordered to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regula I is a scientific research laboratory, if memory serves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Starfleet all we had was a boatload of children but we're the only ship in the quadrant. Spock: those cadets of yours -- how good are they? How will they respond under real pressure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like all living beings, Admiral each according to his gifts. The ship is yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary: just take me to Regula I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse my presumption, but I do not agree. As a teacher on a training mission, I am content to command a Starship. If we are to go on actual duty, it is clear that the senior officer aboard must assume command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it may be nothing; garbled communications. Why don't you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You proceed from a false assumption. I am a Vulcan. I have no ego to bruise. Kirk smiles in bemused wonderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are going to remind me that logic alone dictates your actions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to remind you of nothing, least of all that which you know well. (pause) Your mistake, if I may be so bold, was promotion. Commanding a Starship is your first best destiny. Anything else is a waste of material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would not presume to debate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is wise. In any case, were I to invoke logic, logic clearly dictates that the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the one. Spock inclines his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my superior officer. You are also my friend. I have been and always shall be yours. Kirk is moved. He starts to speak, can't -- finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you accompany me to the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd best talk with Mr. Scott, first so that he may, in his own words, explain the situation to his cadets. Kirk's face tells us the wisdom of Spock's choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating quietly around the planet below. Tranquil as we PUSH SLOWLY IN. OVER we can hear, FILTERED, UHURA'S VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regula I, this is Enterprise. This is Enterprise calling. Do you  receive... I say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring Spock and Uhura, as she keeps trying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Again, this is Enterprise calling Space Lab Regula I. Come in, please. Dr. Marcus. Please respond, please -- it's no use; no response from Regula I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But no longer jammed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. No nothing. Spock considers, moves to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two possibilities, sir they are unwilling to respond, they are unable to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hours and forty-three minutes, present speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up Genesis, she said. What in God's name does that mean? Give it up to whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might help my analysis if I knew what Genesis was. Kirk looks at him, nods; rising now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, ask Dr. McCoy to join us in my quarters. Mr. Saavik, take the con. They start for the Turbo Lifts as Saavik reacts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the sick bay ready. Will someone please tell me what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dims lights) Computer. Request security procedure and access to Project Genesis Summary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identify for retina scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Admiral James T., Starfleet General Staff. Security Class 1. The screen is suddenly busy with coded read-outs and then computer graphics of retina patterns. Then it glows green. SECURITY CLEARANCE, CLASS 1 GRANTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Summary, please. More coded read-outs, a red line SECURITY SCAN, then over it APPROVED, in green. Replaced by:

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN INT. CAROL MARCUS' LAB, REGULA I
dialogues.text: Carol appears, FACING CAMERA, not used to it. To one side stands David and behind them, the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol Marcus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dr. Carol Marcus, and I am the director of the Project Genesis team at Regula I. What exactly IS Genesis? Put simply, Genesis is a procedure whereby the molecular structure of any given matter can be restructured -- changed -- into anything else of identical mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stage One of our experiments was conducted in the labora- tory. Stage Two of the series will be attempted in a lifeless underground; Stage Three will involve the process on a plane- tary scale. What follows is a computer projected simulation of Stage Three. Please watch closely.

dialogues.speaker: ILM MONITOR SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: It is our intention to introduce what we call the Genesis device or "torpedo" into the targeted area of a lifeless space body, a moon or other inert form -- the device is fired --

dialogues.speaker: ON BONES, SPOCK AND KIRK
dialogues.text: react with wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Unleashing, almost instantan- eously, what we call the Genesis effect. Particulate matter is reorganized and electrified -- with life introduced results. Instead of a dead moon, a living breathing planet, capable of sus- taining whatever life forms we see fit to deposit on it... The reformed object you see represents the merest fraction of the Genesis potential, should the Federation wish to pursue these experiments to their logical conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we consider the problems of population and food supply, the usefulness of this process begins to become clear. This concludes this demonstration tape. Thank you for your attention. The Genesis team eagerly awaits the decision of the Federation regarding the next phase of our work. The tape becomes snowy and blinks off. Kirk looks at Bones and Spock -- they are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It literally is Genesis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power of creation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they proceeded with their experiments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape was made a year ago. I can only assume they've reached Phase Two by now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But dear Lord, are we intelligent enough to -- Suppose, this thing were used where life already exists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would destroy such life in favor of its new matrix --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's new -- have you any idea what you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was not attempting to evaluate its moral implications, Doctor. As a matter of cosmic history, it has always been easier to destroy than to create --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore! Now you can do both at the same time! According to myth, the earth was created in six days. Watch out: here comes Genesis; we'll do it for you in six minutes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't dispute that in the wrong hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to tell me whose are the right hands, my cold-blooded friend? Are you in favor of these experiments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this isn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Dr. McCoy; you cannot ban the acquisition of knowledge because you distrust the moral implications of what you learn. Logic suggests --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logic?? We're talking about universal Armageddon, you inhuman bloodless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Admiral, sensors indicate a vessel in our area, closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make of her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one of ours, Admiral... It's Reliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov's on Reliant, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whoosh of the turbo doors and Kirk, Bones and Spock assume their posts. Saavik stands next to Kirk's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not responding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the emergency channels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise to Reliant. Come in, Reliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture, Mr. Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space; a tiny dot in the distance, growing larger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attempt visual communication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible their COMM system has failed -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would explain a great many things --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boring forward ominously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan and his crew; no sign of Chekov and Terrell. On Khan's screen, the Enterprise grows larger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost sing-song with joy) Slow to one-half impulse power. Let's be friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowing to one-half impulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're requesting visual communications, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them eat static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still running with shields down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. We're one big happy fleet. Ah, Kirk, my old friend, do you know the Klingon proverb that tells us revenge is a dish that is best served cold? (pause) It is very cold in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant in our section this quadrant, sir, and slowing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual. Visual of Reliant appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, may I quote General Order 12: 'On the approach of any vessel, when communications have not been est --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, the Admiral is aware of the Regulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watches the screen) This is damned peculiar. (beat) Yellow alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Energize defense fields. ALARMS SOUND. The lights on the bridge dim into the soft reddish glow of battle illumination. ADDITIONAL CREW troop in to man vacant consoles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a voice message... wait ... short range band. They say their Chambers coil is shorting their COMM system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanning... He steps to his station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two ships are very close, barely moving as they inch toward each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still haven't raised their shields. Khan is half out of his seat, sweating with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful: Not all at once. The engine room. Lock on target and prepare to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locking phasers on target. Computer graphics monitor: Cross-hairs on Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reacts to his blue-lit scope --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their coil emissions are normal... Wait: their shields are going up. They're locking phasers -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise shields! Energize phasers, stand by to -- But the ENTIRE BRIDGE is ROCKED by a shock impact, some of the crew sent flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant firing phasers at Enterprise. A hit in the rear of the engine room area, debris flying into the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion rips through the facility, sending yellow- ish green GAS hurtling down the long facility towards us. Crewmen are hurled through the air, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT AUTO DOORS
dialogues.text: roll closed, sealing off the damaged tail section,

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAINEES
dialogues.text: terrified, scramble to get out amid the deadly yellow- ish green smoke, the cries.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTTY
dialogues.text: trying to rally them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Respirators! Get back! Use your respirators! And he puts his own respirator on, as do some of the veterans. Preston dons his respirator -- and stays.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE ROOM
dialogues.text: The angle we saw during inspection. The trainees, in panic amid the gas crawl over each other trying to get out. They scramble over each other's shoulders in the efforts to escape, screaming and shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge is slowly righting. Crew members getting back to their stations. On speaker, we hear the CRIES AND SHOUTS of the Engine Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu... The shields!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical Alert: Engine Room. Bones dashes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get power, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty! Scotty's voice is faint, drowned by the screams and cries from a dozen intercom stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Uhura, turn off those damn  channels!! Uhura does. There is a dead silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott on discrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, let's have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind, the crew chief and a few others work feverishly in respirators. Scotty, in respirator, with a throat mike which filters his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hanging on, sir. Main energizers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN computer graphics, red flashing lights indi- cate damaged areas. Spock steps up to Kirk evaluating the display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knew just where to hit us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHO? Who knew just where to hit us? And why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) One thing is certain; we cannot escape on auxiliary power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual! (sees visual) Mr. Sulu, divert everything to the phasers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re screen) Too late -- On VISUAL SCREEN, Photon torpedoes approach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on! The bridge is shaken badly, screens go dark, fires spark and erupt. ALARMS and SOUND full. Crew personnel try to put out electrical fires, help the fallen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: circling Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glow of the O.S. screens and battle illumination highlighting the passion in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firefighting continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty -- what's left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the batteries, sir. I can have auxiliary power in a few minutes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have minutes. Can you give me phaser power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few shots, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough against their shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral... Commander Reliant is signaling. (a pause) He wishes to discuss terms of our surrender. There is a moment. Kirk looks around the battered bridge, and his eyes meet Spock's, and Saavik's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating) Admiral --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, while we have time. All eyes go to the SCREEN. After momentary visual confusion, Khan's face appears, smiling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; dumbfounded) Khan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still remember, Admiral. I cannot help but be touched. Of course, I remember you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the meaning of this attack? Where is the crew of the Reliant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely I have made my meaning plain. I mean to avenge myself upon you, Admiral. I've deprived your ship of power and when I swing round I mean to deprive you of your life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see Reliant making a large arc as she prepares to come back for another round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen) -- But I wanted you to know first who it was who had beaten you: I, Khan Noonian Singh, the eagle you attempted to cage forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan, listen to me -- if its me you want, I'll have myself beamed aboard. All I ask is that you spare my crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a most intriguing offer. Typical, I must say of your sterling character. Let me think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant continues her slow arc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen) I make you a counter-proposal, I will agree to your terms, if in addition to yourself, you turn over to me all data and material regarding the project called Genesis. Reactions from Spock and Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genesis, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play with me, Kirk, my hand is on the phaser control --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me some time to recall the data on our computers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you sixty seconds, Admiral. Kirk turns from the screen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, you can't give him Genesis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we know he hasn't got it. Just keep nodding as though I'm giving orders. Saavik, punch up the data charts of Reliant's command console -- hurry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant's command...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HURRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prefix code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Khan) We're finding it. (urging) Please, please -- you've got to give us time -- the bridge is smashed, computers inoperative...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is a luxury you do not have, Admiral: forty-five seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant, her arc completed, is coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand -- Kirk puts on his spectacles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to learn WHY things work on a Starship. (to Khan) It's coming through now, Khan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (descends) The prefix code is 16309. All commands from each Starship bridge are relayed electronically; each ship has its own prefix combination code...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to prevent an enemy from doing just what we're attempting; using our console to tap in a message, an order to lower Reliant's damn shields...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the weapons console) Let's hope he hasn't changed the combination. He's quite intelligent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) Wait for my signal, Spock -- too soon and he'll have time to figure it out and raise them again. Spock nods; Kirk turns to the screen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Khan, how do I know you'll keep your word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen) I've given you no word to keep, Admiral. In my judgment, you simply have no alternative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take your point. Stand by to receive our transmission. He turns from the screen again, softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Mr. Sulu, lock phasers on target and await my command...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Phasers locked... They're all sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up, Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) Here it comes. Now, Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: followed by other signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at his console) Sir -- our shields are dropping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise them -- Joachim punches frantically --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the over-ride?? All monitors are haywire now that Enterprise is tapped in. They search wildly for the right switch, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: punching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise fires at Reliant inflicting heavy damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shambles -- debris flying; Khan knocked to the deck. He struggles to his feet through wiring --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) At them! At them! FIRE! FIRE! Why can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't fire, sir; they've damaged the photon controls and the warp drive. We must withdraw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we must! (desperate urging) We must repair the damage. Enterprise will wait; she's not going anywhere. Khan calms as the other holds him; he breathes deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant turns away.

dialogues.speaker: ENTERPRISE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: They watch on screen as Reliant hauls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Sir, you did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) I did nothing -- except get caught with my britches down. I must be senile. Mr. Saavik, you just keep right on quoting regulations. Meantime, let's find out what the hell is going on and see how bad we've been -- The turbo doors whoosh open as Kirk reaches them. Scotty stands there, tears streaming down his face; he holds the body of Midshipman Preston. Both of them are covered in blood. He sways into Kirk's arms as the others rush forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise, motionless, scars of battle showing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW, wearing respirators amid the motionless ball of gas, work frantically at a dozen jobs, trying to put things aright, splicing wires, etc. Some TRAINEES who panicked are back.

dialogues.speaker: FEATURE THE CREW CHIEF
dialogues.text: making a final adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit your blowers! A TURBO WHINES and a great wind of suction pulls the gas towards appropriate vents. The Crew Chief watches, then yanks off his respirator; wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MANY CASUALTIES IN EVIDENCE. Kirk enters and LEADS CAMERA THROUGH them; he has a word or two for men he doesn't know by name. Kirk leads us to the operating theatre, where Bones works over Preston. Scotty stands by, his lips trembling. Preston opens his eyes, sees Scotty and Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint) Is the word given?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) The word is given: warp speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost smiles) Aye... He dies. Pause. Scotty looks across the body at Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Preston) He wants to kill me for passing sentence on him 14 years ago -- and he doesn't care who stands between him and his vengeance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stayed at his post. When the trainees ran, he stayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he hadn't, we'd be space by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
