dialogues.text: Admiral, this is Spock. Kirk hits a wall intercom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine room reports auxiliary power restored. We can proceed at impulse power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) Best speed to Regula I. Kirk out. Scotty, I've got to ask: Any chance of getting the mains back on the line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dinna think so, sir, but you'll have my best -- With an effort, he gets to his feet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Thanks -- I know you tried, Doctor... Squeezes his shoulder and limps off -- We NOW HEAR the sound of impulse power taking effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Bones shrugs unhappily, looks at Preston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctors lose patients sometimes. Damn. I'm still in the dark: How'd he know about Genesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the moment that question takes a back seat to preventing him from laying his hands on it. You said it yourself; we're talking about a bang that would re-arrange the universe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There may still be time... you gave as good as you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks him in the eye) I got beat. We're only alive because I knew something about these ships that he didn't. He turns and leaves as Bones watches, looks again at Preston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regula, the dead planet beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching. As she moves slowly PAST CAMERA, WE PAN WITH her TO SEE that she is approaching the space lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battle damage, some repaired, some not. The bridge is filled with tension, all hands at station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching Regula and Space Lab Regula I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space Station Regular I, this is Starship Enterprise. Come in, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before, Uhura's image, imploring a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say again. Space Station Regular. This is Starship Enterprise. Please respond. Please respond. During this, CAMERA HAS PANNED CLOSE AMONG the techni- cal clutter. Then suddenly. SOUND -- eerie, frightening. Our ears cannot place it... and before we can, it is gone a warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No response, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensors, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanners and sensors still inoperative. There's no way to tell what's  inside the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no way of knowing if Reliant is still in the area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with irony) ... Blind as a Tiberian Bat. What do you make of the plantoid beyond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regula is class "D'. It consists of various remarkable ores. Essentially, a great rock in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant could be hiding behind that rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distinct possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine room... Scotty, do we have enough power for the transporters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just barely, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the decision) I'm going down to the station. He starts out. Bones stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan could be down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's BEEN there and hasn't found what he wants. Can you spare someone? There may be people hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can spare me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begging the Admiral's pardon: General Order 15: 'No  flag officer shall beam into a hazardous area without armed escort.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no such regulation. Saavik's gaze falters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) All right, join the party. Mr. Spock, the ship is yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye sir --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish a parking orbit around the station and send me a complete damage report when you've talked with Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Jim... Kirk, Bones and Saavik head for the turbo doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSER ANGLE now. The silence is ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: empty, except for the hums and crackles of abandoned equipment. With a FAMILIAR SOUND, BONES, KIRK and SAAVIK MATERIALIZE. All have phasers, communicators and tricorders. For a moment they look around, seeing emptiness. Like being in a haunted house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...! Anybody here? A WEIRD ECHO reverberates his cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises tricorder) Indeterminate life signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phasers on stun. Move out. They separate. Each begins to search.

dialogues.speaker: SAAVIK
dialogues.text: She moves to the electronic and data area, examines the consoles, the equipment, then settles for the data bank. She starts keying sequences with the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows signs of fear as he walks through the deserted place, like a scuba diver exploring a cave. We want him to go back. A NOISE. Bones reacts with brave apprehension. Rounding a corner, he starts: A RAT scuttles right in front of him. Bones sighs with relief and moves forward. We think he's safe. SUDDENLY SOMETHING FALLS RIGHT ON HIS FACE: an upside down human ARM.

dialogues.speaker: SAME LOCALE
dialogues.text: Kirk helps Bones cut down the last of the five BODIES from where they were hanged, upside down. Having recovered his composure, Bones examines the corpses. We RECOGNIZE Madison, March, among others. One is clearly the COOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) They even killed the galley chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one looks like a Steward. They're not warm, but rigor hasn't set in. This didn't happen all that long ago, Jim. Kirk looks around, despairingly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH SAAVIK working with console. Something puzzles her. She frowns, but a NEW SOUND distracts her. She looks up and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LAB
dialogues.text: A moan is heard. All three now converge on the area. As they near it, Saavik's tricorder hums furiously. Be this a room, a locker of some other place, this time they -- "open the door." The limp bodies of Chekov and Terrell fall out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen) Admiral Kirk, Enterprise. Come in, please. Come in please. She will continue sporadically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God! Chekov emits a live, reassuring moan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Clark Terrell, Jim, I've served with him. Bones is passing his medical tricorder over Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Brain disturbance. Appears to be drug induced. He reaches into his kit. He shoots Chekov moves off to Terrell. Uhura, voice continues in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik, for God's sake, tell her we're all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say again. This is Enterprise. Please acknowledge signal. Please -- Saavik's face appears on her screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen, hurried) Commander Uhura, this is Lt. Saavik. We're all right. Please stand by. Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled) Aye, aye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov opens his eyes, and stares into Kirk's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Admiral...! He weeps like a child, and Kirk holds him. Meanwhile, Terrell opens his eyes and stares at Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Dr. McCoy, Captain. Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy? Yes. Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov breaks the embrace in high relief and anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sir. It was Khan! We found him on Ceti Alpha V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Pavel... Tell me what you can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No life signs -- but he was there. Captured us. He -- he put creatures in our bodies. To control our minds. Bones takes over Chekov --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, you're safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Made us say -- lies... Do... things... But we beat him... The Captain and me. -- He thought he controlled us, but he didn't ... The Captain was strong. Chekov breaks into tears. Kirk looks at Terrell, who is more composed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain. Where is Dr. Marcus? Where are the Genesis materials?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't find them. Some of the scientists were still here, but everything else, even the data banks -- were empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true, Admiral. All the memory cells have been emptied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ponders) Erased...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tortured those people. None of them would tell him anything. He went wild, strung them up and slit their throats. He wanted to tear the place apart, but he was late: he had to get back to Reliant in time to blow you to bits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came damn close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left us. (with irony) We were no longer of use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is  the Reliant crew? Dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marooned on Ceti Alpha V. He's completely mad, Admiral. He blames you for the death of his wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what he blames me for. (thinks) The escape pods are all in place. (looks around) Where's the transporter room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, wearing his spectacles, studies the transporter consoles. ANGLE WIDENS TO REVEAL the transporter pods, and the others, b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he make it down here? Chekov and Terrell look at each other; they seem a bit stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not my impression. He spent most of his time trying to wring the information out of the people. Saavik approaches Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything? Kirk looks at her over the rims of the glasses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody left the unit on. If everyone else was dead, it implies that no one remained to turn it off. Those people back there bought escape time for Genesis with their lives. Saavik studies the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make sense. These coordinates are well within Regula -- a plantoid we know to be lifeless and airless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheels turn) If Stage Two was completed, it was underground -- she said it was going to be underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stage Two of what? Kirk gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on communicator) Kirk to Enterprise. Damage report, Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, if we go by the book, like Lieutenant Saavik, hours could seem like days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I read you, Captain. Let's have it. Fractional pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation is grave, Admiral. We won't have main power for six days at least. Auxiliary power has temporarily failed, but maybe we can restore that in two days. By the book, Admiral. Kirk frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning you can't even beam us back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at present. Kirk looks at Saavik and Bones, decides --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Spock, if you do not hear from us within one hour your orders are to restore what power you can, take the Enterprise to the nearest Star Base and alert Starfleet command when you are out of jamming range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- we won't leave you behind...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, if you don't hear from us, there won't be anybody behind. Kirk out. (to Terrell and Chekov) You gentleman can remain here, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's all the same, Admiral, we'd like to share the risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Very well. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go? Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to console) Where they went. Saavik. Kirk walks onto the pods as Saavik works the console, rolling in electronic coding. The others join Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if they went -- nowhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then this will be your big chance to get away from it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready. She presses a button, joins them on the pods. Slowly they VANISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES TOWARD it as the BEAM SOUND continues, with irregularity. The plantoid is ugly and dead. The sound frightens us, and climaxes with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEAM SOUND screeches, then settles into its comfort- able mode as the FIVE FIGURES FLUCTUATE, FADE, then APPEAR. They look around in wonder and relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral -- She indicates something O.S. They cross as CAMERA reveals a cave wall stacked with technical materials and crowned by a LARGE PROJECTILE, a giant version of the model we saw earlier. They stare. (N.B. FEATURE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genesis, I presume. They walk by a group of crates. It all happens very fast: David leaps out and tackles Kirk, throwing him to the ground and landing atop him, a knife at his throat. At the same time, Bones and Saavik reach for their phasers, but Jedda, already armed, steps out. He has them covered and helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the sonavabitch who committed mass murder up there. He raises the knife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Admiral Kirk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were still there, you dumb bastard! We could hear the screams all the way to the transporter room -- Again he raises the knife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dr. Marcus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Doctor Marcus! Carol reaches the tunnel entrance to the cave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, go back! Carol sees Kirk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back. I'm going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a breath) You do that and you'll have murdered your father. All react. David and Kirk, facing each other, are turned to stone. Bones, Jedda and Chekov turn to look at Carol, wondering. Terrell very casually takes the phaser from Jedda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) I'll hold onto this. But Kirk and Carol ignore them and walk towards each other. There are tears in Carol's eyes. She reaches up, trying to smile and touches his hair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a little grey -- She can't. Kirk takes her and holds her tightly, look- ing at David, over her shoulder. He stands there, stunned, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol. Is that true? She nods --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's making it up! My father was Professor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, you're just making this harder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's even harder than you think, Doctor. He and Chekov have their phasers trained on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Please don't move --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Admiral. Terrell speaks into his wrist recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your excellency, have you been listening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I have indeed, Captain. You have done well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it -- ! David makes a reckless break for Terrell; Saavik instantly throws herself on him bringing him down as Terrell fires, hitting Jedda, who was behind David -- a killing ray. Jedda dematerializes. Carol SCREAMS and David reacts with horror and guilt. Most importantly, Chekov begins to tremble. Terrell himself is shaken by his reflexive action. He's in semi-panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move -- any of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 thru 134

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant, motionless in a parking orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joachim over his shoulder. Others in evidence. Khan speaks into his console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... We're waiting. What's the delay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is well, sir. You have the coordinates to beam up Genesis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first, Captain. Kill Admiral Kirk. Reactions by all -- only Kirk and Bones are unsurprised. David and Saavik, dazed, fight the urge to do something. Chekov is close to a seizure. Terrell fights conflicting mental signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellency... it is difficult. I try to obey, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him. As though tearing off a leach, Terrell grabs at the wrist recorder and flings it to the ground. A shock- wave of pain hits Terrell. He recovers, trembling and tries to obey. Chekov is shaking badly. Terrell aims his phaser at Kirk. Chekov slowly raises his phaser and aims at Terrell, though his hands are like lead. We THINK Chekov is going to do the right thing. Then, shockingly: Terrell turns his phaser on himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still emanates from wrist recorder) Kill him, Terrell. Now. Terrell does, blowing himself into oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING CHEKOV
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS, horribly, drops his phaser, clutching his head. Bones leaps to his side, pulls an injection device from his belt pack, jabs it into Chekov's arm. Chekov, almost with a sigh of relief, drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrell? Chekov -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim -- for God's sake! They rush to his side, as do Carol and David.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING CHEKOV
dialogues.text: From the fallen man's ear, something begins to emerge.

dialogues.speaker: CHEKOV'S EAR
dialogues.text: The Ceti eel crawls out. It has grown quite large.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Horror from all. Kirk picks up a phaser. As the eel clears Chekov, he fires and destroys it. He shudders, then sees the wrist recorder and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan, you bloodsucker, they're finished! You'll have to do your own dirty work now. Do you hear me? Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan reacts to Kirk's VOICE: electronic shock. He clutches the communicator, his eye-whites rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk! Kirk, you are still alive -- my old friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, 'old friend.' You've managed to kill just about everyone else, but like a poor marksman, you keep missing the target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic) Perhaps I no longer need to try. He punches several buttons. In the Rocky Cavern the transporter beam locks on to the Genesis torpedo and its arming control box. As Kirk and the others watch, horrified, Khan beams up the materials. David tries to reach the torpedo, but Saavik holds him fast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go -- he can't -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only half of you would get there. The beam disappears and Genesis with it, leaving them alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Khan, you have Genesis, but you don't have me! You were going to kill me, Khan, it was your sole purpose. You'll have to come down here to do it! You'll have to come down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done far worse than kill you, Admiral. I've hurt you. And I wish to go on hurting you. I shall leave you, as you left me -- where no one will ever find you: poetic justice; marooned for eternity in the center of a dead planet -- buried alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Admiral. Oh, and don't count on Enterprise. She can't move. My next act will be to blow her out of the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khan closes his eyes in voluptuous satisfaction. Joachim enters and Khan looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp drive still inoperative. All other systems should be restored shortly. Khan sighs, contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. We have all the time in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before, Saavik is on the communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lt. Saavik, calling Enterprise... She keeps trying. Chekov stirs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive! Bones goes and tends Chekov who moans, tries to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pavel? Chekov tries to smile; Kirk takes his hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No use, Admiral, they're still jamming all channels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks across Chekov) It wouldn't make any difference. If Enterprise obeyed orders she's long since gone. And if she couldn't obey, she's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are we, it looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Who's responsible for all this? Who is Khan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appear to have plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) You and your father can catch up on things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter) My father. I hope you realize another man has just been killed because of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of you, son. You shouldn't have tried to rush someone holding a primed phaser. Anyway it isn't one man dead, it's two, in case you've lost count. David has been effectively spiked. Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anything to eat? I don't know about anyone else, but I'm starved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you think of food at a time like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first order of business is survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's food in the Genesis cave, enough to last a lifetime -- should that be necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought this was Genesis. Carol laughs -- there's an edge of hysteria to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This? It took the Starfleet corps of engineers ten months in space suits to tunnel out all this. What we did in there -- we did in a day. David, why don't you show Dr. McCoy and the Lieutenant our idea of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can't just sit here -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unruffled) Oh, yes we can. Is there really something to eat? David looks at his father, who checks his watch, putting on his spectacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk) This is just to give us something to do, isn't it? (he shrugs) Come on. Saavik and Bones make to follow. Saavik turns to Kirk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As your teacher Mr. Spock is fond of saying: I like to think there always are possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 149

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark side of Gamma. Reliant sits idle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol sits on the ground, Chekov's head in her lap, looking at Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David was right, wasn't he? It's just to keep them busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you ask me that? Were we together? Where we going to be? You had your world and I had mine. I wanted him in mine, not chasing through the universe with his father. Kirk turns away, overcome. She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He's a lot like you in many ways. Nothing I could do about it. He's smarter, of course; that goes without saying. Most of Genesis is really his. Her joke doesn't take effect. He doesn't turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This is it, isn't it? We're never going to get out of here. Kirk says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Please. Tell me what you're feeling. Kirk hesitates, comes back and sits next to Chekov; he changes Bones' compress on the ear as he finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a man I haven't seen in fifteen years who thinks he's killed me. You show me a son who'd almost be happy to help him. My son. My life that could have been and wasn't. What am I feeling? I'm feeling old -- worn out. Carol studies him; gently she sets Chekov's head down on a sweater, then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you something that will make you feel young -- young as when the world was new. She offers her hand. Kirk looks at Chekov, who smiles, faint assurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He'll be all right. Come. After a moment's hesitation, Kirk takes her hand and she leads him to the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCKING BEFORE Carol and Kirk. A rising light falls on their faces as they walk, then run with excitement toward the source. Kirk races ahead...

dialogues.speaker: MOVING THROUGH THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: toward an iridescent light at its end, blindingly beautiful with color. INTERCUT: THESE TWO ANGLES until WE CAN HARDLY WAIT for Kirk to reach the end of the tunnel, and then, when it does:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the rock tunnel ends. Kirk comes out of the tunnel, and his mouth drops open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge cavern. Kirk is actually standing at the middle of it. Space extends vastly above and below his point of view. Like Eden, lush growth everywhere, water- falls, and a cobalt blue sky high, high above where a round orb glows sending light and warmth downward. There is a path from where Kirk stands down to the lower level where Bones, and the others are waiting and calling to him. Mist and haze waft gently across the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: 150F BACK TO KIRK
dialogues.text: as Carol comes up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this -- in a day?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The matrix formed in a day. The life forms grew later -- at a wildly accelerated rate. Can I cook or can't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbo doors open and Joachim stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impulse power restored. Khan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than a match for poor Enterprise. He punches at his console.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 153

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant ominously pokes her nose into the lit side of the planet, heading for Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Departing dark side, Regula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual --

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: The Regula I Space Station -- but where is Enterprise?

dialogues.speaker: ON KHAN
dialogues.text: frowning with puzzlement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where IS she?

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: not a trace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and the others eat fruit from the huge (matte) forest beyond. Chekov has been moved to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Admiral's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I believe it. She almost smiles. David returns her stare and it throws her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik rises, paces. Kirk puts down his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's what I call a meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like the Garden of Eden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only here, every apple comes from the Tree of Knowledge. Kirk watches Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on your mind, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kobayashi Maru, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The no-win scenario -- and with what philosophy a commander faces defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me if we are playing out that scenario now, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the test, sir, will you tell me what you did? I'd really like to know. Kirk looks at Bones, who smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, you are looking at the only Starfleet cadet who ever beat the no-win scenario --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And almost got tossed out of the Academy... He looks at his watch again, using his glasses --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reprogrammed the simulation so it was possible to rescue the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed the conditions of the test. I received a commendation for original thinking. (pause) I don't like to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then -- you never faced that situation -- faced death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We each face death every day we're alive, Saavik. He picks up the communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Spock, this is Kirk. It's two hours. Are you about ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on schedule, Admiral. Just give us your coordinates and we'll beam you aboard. The others are on their feet, stunned with amazement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I don't like to lose. He clicks off. David gapes at his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE CAN SEE NOW where Enterprise is: she has slipped behind the plantoid, clockwise, even as Reliant was rounding into the lighted side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, David, Saavik, Carol and Bones, holding the semi- conscious Chekov MATERIALIZE. Spock is there to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the damage report -- we were immobilized...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, come, Lieutenant, you of all people go by the book. Hello, Spock. You remember Dr. Marcus... They are moving through the room as they talk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) By the book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regulation 46-A: 'If transmissions are being monitored during battle...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... no uncoded messages on an open channel...' Saavik steps in front of Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I exaggerated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours instead of days, Saavik; now we have minutes instead of hours --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind) I'm taking this bunch to sick bay. CAMERA STAYS WITH THEM, HOLDS ON DAVID, awed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik and Kirk follow Spock. They stop at a Turbo Lift --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're inoperative below C-deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race down corridors as they speak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What IS working around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, Admiral. We have partial main power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best we could do in two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full crew in place as doors whoosh open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overjoyed) Admiral on the bridge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battle stations. ALARMS, SIRENS, ETC. CREW RUSH INTO PLACE AS Kirk, Spock and Saavik approach the big screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Tactical. We see the Enterprise emerging from the dark side of Gamma Regula, where Reliant is now a moving blip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can out-run us and out-gun us. But there is the Mutara Nebula at 153 mark four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studies his console) Scotty, can we make it inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The energizer's bypassed like a Christmas tree -- so don't give me too many bumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No promises, Mr. Scott. On your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble with the nebula, sir, is all that static discharge and gas clouds  our tactical display. Visuals won't  function and shields will be useless. Kirk looks over the rims of his glasses at Spock; they smile with faint amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's sauce for the goose, Mr. Saavik. The odds will be even.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS CORRIDORS, ENTERPRISE
dialogues.text: As the lights change, the CREW runs to their stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, David and Bones react to the light change and the sirens -- Bones works on Chekov...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be in the way, Dr. Marcus... best stay here. Carol and David are civilians on a battleship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacting. Saavik approaches Kirk and Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral... what happens if Reliant fails to follow us into the nebula? Kirk and Spock exchange looks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can guarantee she'll follow us, Mr. Saavik. Remind me to explain to you the concept of human ego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best speed, Scotty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise whooshes by CAMERA leaving Regula behind. Reliant now appears in far b.g. and CAMERA BEGINS A MOVE to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Full impulse power! Not so wounded as we were led to believe -- so much the better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant moves to and past CAMERA in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call them SPACE-BYS. Enterprise rushes TOWARD US, flashes BY and CONTINUES towards the swirling nebula. THEN Reliant does the same, closer in pursuit. At this moment, half the distance between Regula and the nebula has been covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estimating nebula penetration in two minutes. Reliant is closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady as you go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orientation, SHOT. Reliant can clearly see where Enterprise is headed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll lose them if they go in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rake her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant's shot crosses Enterprise's bow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship reverberates with the near miss. Chekov wakes up, looks wildly about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I must --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Pavel; you haven't the strength or the equilibrium --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- As they talk, David, unnoticed, leaves the area. The Enterprise is buffeted again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. McCoy, I can't just sit here. Tell me what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) You can help get my surgery squared away. I'm expecting customers. She whitens in fear. ANOTHER SHOT reverberates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was close --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unfazed) They just don't want us going in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute to nebula perimeter. The bridge door slides open and David enters. He stares in wonder. Saavik reacts to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Admiral, they're reducing speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, patch me in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we slowing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We daren't follow them into the nebula, sir -- our shields will be useless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Admiral Kirk. Khan's eyes bulge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We tried it once your way, Khan. Are you game for a rematch? Khan's eyes bulge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Khan -- ! I'm laughing at the "superior" intellect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full impulse power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir! We have Genesis -- Whatever you want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full power damn you! And he reaches across and executes it himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They react to Reliant's speed-up. The nebula approach is ON SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry) I'll say this for him: he's consistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE VERY CLOSE NOW, and SEE CLEARLY the swirling, slowly moving gases, magenta, purple, etc. There are veils of luminescent materials and through all an interlace of unpredictable electrical charges. Like lightning, these intermittent great flashes illumine whole sections of the nebula. OUR VIEW is moving slowly forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timing) And we're... in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Enterprise whooshes into the PICTURE headed into the purplish gas -- and disappears into a cloud bank of the stuff. A moment then Reliant APPEARS, pursues Enterprise into the gloom, also disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN the picture is squirrelly purple, breaking up. Blindness. Panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries) Inoperative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise the shields... Electrical forces raging without are also reflected on the circuits within. It's bumpy, on top of everything else. Electronic WHINING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I feared, sir. Not functional. I'm reducing speed. Khan does not argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously Reliant emerges from a massive "cloudbank." Electrical discharges abound. Barely moving, she feels her way forward. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A treat: Enterprise is above and behind Reliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant's image is breaking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phaser lock inoperative, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best guess, Mr. Sulu. Fire when ready. Sulu strains, then fires -- just as an electrical dis- turbance bounces the bridge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bounce causes Sulu's phaser shot to go wide of Reliant, amid CRACKLING discharges --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolls from the near-miss concussion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aft-torpedoes -- fire -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant is wide of the mark with a Photon torpedo. A BLINDING ELECTRICAL DISCHARGE. When it clears, Enterprise appears to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN, nothing but magenta amid picture breakup --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweating) Hold your course. Look sharp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise feeling its way...

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: All peer into the lousy picture. Occasional electrical flashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still Enterprise moves forward... A LARGE FLASH... a SUDDEN GLIMPSE: Reliant boring in on collision course!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden clearing ON SCREEN: Reliant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evasive starboard! Hard over, but not fast enough. Reliant fires a phaser.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Reliant's phaser shot hits the Enterprise torpedo room in Dorsal Fin area of ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION rocks the room and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bridge rattles from the explosion below; Sulu is thrown from his chair. Saavik leaps to her post --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phaser bank one, fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise fires a phaser and delivers a raking shot -- which rips along the side of Reliant's primary hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge is damaged; Joachim and others are wounded...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joachim! For the first time, his friend wounded, Khan hesitates, holds him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours... is... the superior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall avenge you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She veers to one side with the impact and disappears into a deep purple mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu is being helped by David --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage, Scotty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones is there, helping some crewmen. The Reactor Room  flashes a red warning light and glows with a blue  light. The air is heavy with smoke but the doors, damaged earlier, still hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, I've got to take the mains off the line. The energizer's shaken loose and I can't get in there to fix her -- radiation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we'll do the job with auxiliary power. The bridge door opens and closes; Chekov, faint, stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you use another hand, Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man the weapons console, Mr. Chekov. ANGLE FAVORING David as the others react to Chekov taking his place. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Spock?                              Spock is bent over the scanner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sporadic energy readings port side, aft. Could be an impulse turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't break off now. If he followed me this far he'll be back. But from where...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's intelligent, but not experienced. His pattern indicates two dimensional thinking... Kirk looks at him, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Saavik, all stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stop, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Descend ten thousand meters. Stand by photon torpedoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant in purplish mass, banking slightly, completing a long turn, then boring ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reliant emerges from the dark blue mass into a clear almost tranquil place. Reliant, moving slowly, stops, as if looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screens are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Where in God's name is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant motionless in the f.g. amid occasional flashes. Now, behind Reliant and from below, like a great whale rising from the depths, Enterprise rises vertically, slowly passing the unsuspecting enemy. When Enterprise is above, behind and quite close:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant ON SCREEN, intermittent but clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torpedoes ready, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fires torpedo; one which hits, destroying Reliant's weapons pod on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C)   EXPLOSIONS rock the interior of Reliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fires two more times. The first causes general damage. The second, close behind blasts Reliant's port engine off into space, debris scattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is devastated. Khan is blown from his chair and WE'RE UNCERTAIN of his fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant, now a scarred, battered hulk, her main hull still intact, but dead in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cheers, just deadly professionalism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cease fire. Look sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power levels quite low, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to intercom) Mr. Scott, can you get the mains back on line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking up slightly)  I'll need ten minutes, sir, 'til the radiation dissipates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, send to Commander, Reliant: prepare to be boarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the smoke and ruins, WE SEE no signs of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, Reliant, this is Enterprise. Surrender and prepare to be boarded. Repeat... In f.g., chillingly, Khan rises INTO SHOT by the main console. He is horribly burned, and it is clear that he is clinging to life by his will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Kirk. The game's not over. As Uhura's voice continues O.S., Khan pulls himself into a chair at the console, one of his hands useless at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) To the last I will grapple with thee! Painfully, with one good arm, he starts arming the Genesis console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There sits the Genesis torpedo: lights start blinking in response. As we watch, the CHILD we met on Ceti Alpha walks to the torpedo and smiles at the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise to Reliant: you are ordered to surrender your vessel. Respond! (to Kirk) Nothing, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll beam aboard. Alert transporter room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral. Scanning an energy source on Reliant. A pattern I've never seen. David peers closer over Spock's shoulder, reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Genesis Wave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on a build up to detonation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We encoded four minutes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll beam aboard and stop it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't! The briefest stunned moment. Kirk hits intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, I need warp speed in three minutes or we're all dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Scotty! Spock leaps from his place and disappears through the bridge doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Saavik, get us out, best speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise backs away from Reliant. Her speed is pain- fully slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN, Enterprise, intermittent image, backs away. Khan smiles triumphantly through his pain. An elec- tronic power SOUND has been building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... You can't get away... From hell's heart I stab at thee... (amid the pain) For hate's sake... I spit my last breath at thee! Khan topples forward, dead. The WHINE continues to build chillingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock rushes in. Bones ministers to Scotty, b.g. Spock sizes up the situation, starts for the radiation room, Bones intercepts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your Vulcan mind? No human can tolerate the radiation loose in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, as you are so fond of observing, Doctor, I'm not human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going in there -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't stop to discuss this logically -- He gives Bones the Vulcan nerve pinch. Bones goes down. Spock presses the access button and enters the Reactor Room, a separated area behind radiation-proof glass and metal, RED FLASHING LIGHTS and an iridescent blue glow within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in horror) Spock -- get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in blue light, arcing energy around him, Spock is a silhouetted figure as he goes to work, door clos- ing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHINE increasing, the dead ship Reliant alive with danger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snail's pace compared to the escape speed needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time from my mark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes, ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Engine room! What's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the glass, Scotty and Bones screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! Get out, man! Oh, dear God...!

dialogues.speaker: WITHIN
dialogues.text: WE CAN SEE the silent urging of Bones and Scotty. Spock is oblivious. Amid the fire-blue arcs, he moves  to the control panel. Between his hands and the con- trols, power arcs insanely. Spock is in an inferno, a radiation hell, fighting now with all his strength to control it. Slowly, the damping rods move out. Spock moves to a manual control, begins to turn it.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK'S HANDS
dialogues.text: on the manual control, slowly turning black.

dialogues.speaker: HIS FACE
dialogues.text: His face, using all the self discipline he is capable of to control the pain, continuing to work --

dialogues.speaker: WITHOUT
dialogues.text: Bones and Scotty react in helpless horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise still well within the nebula, Reliant a figure still visible in b.g. She's crawling still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliant, now symbol of death, ON SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three minutes, thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distance from Reliant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred kilometers. Kirk looks at David, but David shakes his head: No way. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! The mains are back on line -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless you, Scotty. Go, Saavik! She increases power and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)   With a burst of warp speed, Enterprise accelerates out of the lazy pace and whooshes PUT OF SCENE, leaving Reliant behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: disappearing in the swirls of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which clears the flame and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: roaring through space -- and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHINE increases to fever pitch, then: she goes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reliant goes, so goes the nebula. The "Genesis Effect" WE SAW in its earliest experiments, now  seems familiar on a gigantic, cosmic scale. The blinding flash at first, followed by the same tumbling turbulence of the miniature test. It is awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge doors open and Carol appears. Instinctively she draws near her son. Finally, Kirk turns, sees Carol --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reduce speed. My God, Carl. Look at it. ON SCREEN and INTERCUT -- GENESIS TUMBLES and starts evolving. A moment in history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing, on intercom) Engine Room. Well done. Scotty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Jim, you'd better get down here. Hurry. The tone frightens Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik, take the con. He moves through the doors quickly, leaving the rest staring at the new world evolving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is endless. Kirk runs forever, feet pounding down, down, down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clouds tumble and move, new things lie beyond --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk races --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk emerges to encounter Scotty and Bones. Their looks tell him. He sees the flashing light over the Reactor Room. He dashes for the control panel. Bones grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir! You'll flood the whole compartment...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll die -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also holds him) He's dead already, Jim. Kirk's eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With stunned understanding, Kirk stumbles to the door, sees Spock on his knees, hands blackened, face cracked with radiation lines and scars. Spock shakes his head. With a feeble hand he reaches the intercom button: filtered communication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship -- out of danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- Spock is satisfied; he fights for breath --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't grieve, Admiral -- it's logical: the good of the many outweighs -- He almost keels over. Kirk has tears streaming down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the good of the few...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the one. He props a hand on the glass to support himself. Kirk's hand reflexively goes to match Spock's on the other side of the glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I never took the Kobayashi Maru test -- until now. What do you think of my solution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been -- and always will be -- your friend... Live. Long. And.  Prosper. Spock falls. Bones and Scotty react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Admiral, you've got to see this! There's new life -- a whole new world, a Genesis world -- ! But Kirk is past hearing or caring. He is huddled up against the glass, destroyed. Bones looks on, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spectacular look at Carol's planet being born!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: the Ship's Company in full dress uniforms assembled for ship's burial service. Over the PULLBACK, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In accordance with the traditions of Starfleet and of Article 184 Starfleet Regulations, we are assembled here today to pay final respects to our honored dead. Carol and David are PROMINENTLY FEATURED. David watching Kirk attentively. So are Sulu, Uhura, Chekov, and Saavik. Bones stands next to Kirk. Scotty carries his bagpipes. Saavik wears her hair down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And yet, in the midst of our sorrow it should be noted that this death takes place in the shadow of new life, the sunrise of a new world, a world that our beloved comrade gave his own life to protect and nourish. He did not feel that sacrifice a vain or empty one -- and we will not debate his profound wisdom, in these proceedings. Of my friend, I can only say this, that of all the souls I have encountered  in my travels, his was the most -- (he falters) -- human. He tries to go on, but catches Bones' face: Bones is streaming tears. Kirk can't go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lieutenant Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: Saavik steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We commend the soul of our brother departed. We love we commit his body to the depths of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honors -- hup! All Starfleet personnel salute. Scotty begins to PIPE, an odd blare which mellows into Amazing Grace. Kirk nods a signal.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAPSULE
dialogues.text: A gleaming black projectile is carried by pallbearers into the launching chamber, which locks behind it. At a hand signal from a TORPEDOMAN, the projectile is fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's remains seen on their way to the new world.  The capsule grows too small to SEE. The bagpipes STOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return -- hup! The salute drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. She steps to him and they exchange salutes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; very  quietly) After you dismiss the company, you will take the watch. Set course  for Ceti Alpha V and we'll pick up  survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in my quarters if needed, but I would prefer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aloud) Dismiss the company. They salute. She about-faces as Kirk walks towards the  Turbo Lift. Saavik issues dismissal and posting  orders, but WE TRUCK with Kirk until CAMERA STOPS and he leaves FRAME and WE HOLD on David. He finally understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long moment, the CAMERA DISCOVERS Kirk. He pours a drink, then decides not to have it. He sits wearily, not knowing how to shake the ghosts. Then he sees the book. Kirk picks up the battered volume, the gift from his friend, and closes his eyes a moment. Almost idly he starts turning pages, looking for a clue. But he can't see the writing -- he rummages through his pockets and pulls out the half-glasses -- One of the lenses is broken. It has a deep impact on Kirk. He puts down the book and glasses and covers his eyes. A SOFT BONG. Kirk clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... come. The door whooshes open and closes to admit David. The last person Kirk expected to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to intrude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no... (rises) I should be on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you running away from me? David's strength is turning a corner with Kirk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I was. (pause) I poured a drink. Would you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I -- I guess I'm not what you expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rueful) I didn't expect anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes two of us. (he studies his father) Lieutenant Saavik was right: you never have faced death --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse) Not like this -- no. I haven't faced death, I cheated death. I tricked my way out of death and patted myself on the back for my ingenuity. I know nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew enough to tell Saavik that how we face death is at least as important as how we face life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But good words. That's where ideas begin. Maybe you should listen to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. My friends were killed, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am truly sorry. Pause. They study each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong about you. And I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you came here to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mainly. (he starts out, then turns -- ) And also that I'm proud -- very proud -- to be your son. A stunned moment, then Kirk lets it all hang out: for David, for Carol and for Spock. He hugs his son, hold- ing onto him as if to life itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise passes the new planet in all its beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door whooshes. Kirk strides on the bridge, David with him. Carol is there with Bones; they are glad at what they see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral on the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you were, Mr. Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. On course to Ceti Alpha. All is well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I believe you already know my, uh, son -- Saavik comes close to blushing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Yes, well, why don't you show him around and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir -- She takes him off, deadpan amusement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So you turn out to be the dumb bastard. They stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That is a little joke. Kirk has a smile. He joins Bones and Carol facing the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's changed her hair again. (pause) Will you look at that? Think they'll name it for you, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I can help it. We'll name it for our friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) It is a far far better thing I do than I have ever done before... a far better resting place I go to than I have ever known...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) Is that a poem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something Spock was trying to tell me. On my birthday. He shakes his head, remembering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Jim? How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers; smiles) Young. I feel young, Doctor. He turns to Saavik and David --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lieutenant, new course: 'Second star to the right and straight on till morning.' The bridge crackles with lights and CHATTER as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space, the final frontier... These are the continuing voyages of the Starship Enterprise... Her ongoing mission: to explore strange new worlds... to seek out new life and new civilizations... To boldly go where no man has gone before... She is moving out now, passing CAMERA and heading toward the distant stars. She is beautiful and they are beautiful. And as she slowly disappears from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: </font>
